content.webTitle: Folk review: Joan Baez, Day After Tomorrow

fields.headline: Folk review: Joan Baez, Day After Tomorrow
fields.bodyText: Grasslands, wind in your hair, long, dusty roads travelled - it's all evoked in Joan's fine 24th studio album, and her voice, high and flowing, low and gravelly, flows timelessly through it like a mountain stream. Guided by the big, gentle hands of producer Steve Earle, she sings songs by her favourite writers (but no Dylan here), including T-Bone Burnett, Elvis Costello, and Tom Waits (the title track). Classy, magical, and 67, she ponders her exit, but strives on: 'Every day on Earth's another chance to get it right...'
